title: BI-utvecklare till B3 Vibe (Norra Sverige)
description:
**B3 Vibe är ett annorlunda konsultföretag i IT-branschen –** för att vi vågar vara det. Hos oss arbetar proffs, som valt att simma utanför huvudströmmen – yrkesmänniskor som vill lite mer med sin karriär än bara lagom och okej.


Vi är ett företag med en idé som bygger på att de som vill vara vuxna människor ska kunna få vara det. Att få friheten att i hög grad själv kunna styra över sin kompetens- och karriärutveckling och över var och när du arbetar.


Var och hur du kommer genomföra ditt uppdrag beror på kunden - vi har medarbetare som sitter helt på kontoret, de som sitter delvis remote och och några heltid remote. Men vi ser gärna att du är en del av vårt sammanhang och bidrar till den goda kultur vi har - så vi ser det som en förmån att komma in till kontoret på möten och aktiviteter för att bygga relationer och skapa vår *vibe*. Men- vi har ett fysiskt kontor i Sundsvall för den som bor i närheten.

**Vem söker vi?**


BI-utveckling innebär ofta att hantera snabba förändringar, nya teknologier och olika projekt. Att vara flexibel och kunna anpassa sig till förändrade omständigheter är värdefullt för att framgångsrikt hantera utmaningar och leverera lösningar. Även om en BI-utvecklare kan arbeta självständigt är förmågan att arbeta i team viktig. Det inkluderar att kunna samarbeta med andra utvecklare, affärsanalytiker och användare för att förstå och uppfylla gemensamma mål och krav.

 **För att passa i rollen ser vi gärna att du har följande erfarenhet:**

  

* Relevant högskoleexamen alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren tolkar som motsvarig.
* 5+ års erfarenhet av BI- utveckling.
* Goda kunskaper i verktyg som: ETL, PowerBI, Qlik, Informatica, DataVault, Oracle, ODI mm.
* Meriterande: Cloud kompetens.
* Goda kunskaper i tal & skrift i både Svenska och Engelska.
  

**Varför du ska välja B3 Vibe:**


På B3 Vibe är sammanhang, gemenskap och kultur det viktigaste vi har. Även hälsa och wellness är väldigt viktigt för oss – något som binder oss samman utanför världen av teknik och datorer. Många har sökt sig till oss för att hitta balansen i livspusslet. Människor som vill ta vara på sin tid och göra verklighet av sina ambitioner och drömmar. Vi tror nämligen att man kan göra både och.

  

Har du frågor kring rollen eller kring hur det är att arbeta på B3? Tveka inte att kontakta pernilla.nilsson@b3.se ansvarig rekryterare eller Jenny Sjöholm VD på jenny.sjoholm@b3.se.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Sneakersnstuff (SNS), a global leader in the sneaker industry since 1999, is celebrating its 25th anniversary with an exciting e-commerce platform transformation. We are seeking a talented Fullstack Developer to join the E-commerce team and contribute to our journey.
   

  

 As a Fullstack Developer at SNS, you will be pivotal in developing both our web and mobile applications. You will work cross-functionally with various teams to ensure high-quality standards and seamless integration of new features and enhancements. Your role will involve hands-on coding, architecture planning, and to deliver exceptional user experiences across our platforms.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Development: Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code for both front-end and back-end systems.
* System Architecture: Collaborate with the team to define and implement scalable and robust system architectures.
* Integration: Seamlessly integrate third-party services and APIs to enhance our e-commerce platform.
* Optimization: Optimize application performance for maximum speed and scalability.
* Security: Ensure the application’s security and data protection.
* Collaboration: Work closely with the Digital Product Owner, marketing managers, and other developers to deliver high-quality solutions.
* Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends and continuously seek ways to improve and innovate.


**Qualifications:**
* Experience: Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer or similar role in an e-commerce environment.
* Technologies: Strong proficiency with BigCommerce, Next.js, Node.js, Typescript
* Backend Skills: Experience with backend development using Node.js, database management, and API integration.
* DevOps: Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and cloud services (AWS, Vercel, Cloudflare, GCP ).
* Mobile Development: Knowledge of Android and iOS development is a plus.
* Problem-Solving: Proactive and solution-oriented with strong analytical skills.
* Communication : Excellent team player with strong communication skills.
* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.


 If you want to be part of a collaborative and innovative team that is passionate about sneakers and technology – this is the job for you! You will get the chance to engage in continuous learning and career development in a rapidly evolving industry. This position will be key in the evolution of our e-commerce platform, driving the future of online sneaker retail.
   

  

 Apply now!
   

  

*Note that a Swedish working permit is required for this position.*

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core) to collaborate on our cloud-based communication solutions that are built using the latest versions of C# and .NET Core hosted on AWS using cloud native technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


**Embrace the challenge and join us!**

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Sinch, we help businesses connect with their customers through seamless, powerful communication. As a global leader in the Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS), we leverage innovative technology to enable companies to engage and interact with their users across voice, messaging, and video. Within Operator Engineering, we focus on products within the telecom domain.
   

  

**The essence of the role**
 We are looking for a versatile Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with engineers, product managers, and stakeholders to design, develop, maintain, and support high-quality, scalable software solutions to meet customer needs.
   

  

 You will be an integral part of a collaborative team that embraces agile methodologies and values clean coding practices. Creativity and innovation are key, and we believe that every team member's input is vital for delivering exceptional communication solutions.
   

  

 This hybrid role based in Stockholm reports to the Senior Engineering Manager.
   

  

**As Our Software Engineer, You Will**
* Design, develop, test, and maintain software applications and systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to optimize performance and enhance user experience.
* Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle, from concept to implementation.
* Ensure performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.


**Who You Are**
 You are a problem-solver with keen attention to detail, strong communication skills, and a proven ability to collaborate effectively in team environments. We think you are strong in Java but also willing to accept not to program in Java if that is the current need. You learn new domains quickly and are willing to take on and complete assignments in new areas as needed. You are creative and think outside the box but also understand when there is a need to stay within the box when reality so demands.
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer.
* Good understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
* Strong proficiency in Java programming languages.
* Experience of REST APIs.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud technologies, CI/CD, automation, and pipelines.
* Experience in Apache Kafka.
* Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.


**Are you ready? Join us on our journey!**
 Join us to push the boundaries of communication technology!
   

  

 We will review applications on a rolling basis. So apply soon by submitting your application in English
 **.**
**Benefits**
 At Sinch, we support employees with benefits that adapt regionally, ensuring you have the resources need to thrive. These include health and life insurance, flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, transparent, and inclusive. Our hiring team persistently works towards identifying the people that best fit each open job, based on Sinch's hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.
   

  

 We encourage applications with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly. Don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new insights and perspectives to Sinch!

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 What you need to know about the role This is an exciting opportunity to work on interesting problems together with talented peers in a cross-functional agile team. You will create modern digital products that affect people’s lives for the better within PayPal globally. Your way to Impact In this role you will get the opportunity to work with skilled and highly motivated Engineers (Backend, iOS, Android and QA) to deliver a world class experience for our users. You will tap in to their years of delivery experience to turbo boost your learning so that you can help deliver exciting features and improvements to the Payment/Orders experience serving customers at scale and across multiple Geolocations. Location: Stockholm, Sweden. Duration: 6 Months, starting April 2025.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Your day to day:**
* You will focus on your learning while helping to deliver high quality solutions to our users.
* You will work as part of an agile team, planning, refining, delivering and inspecting sprint deliveries.
* You work closely with product and design to understand context and vision.
* You will learn and work with your peers in the Android chapter to make incremental platform improvements and increase learning opportunities for all in a supportive environment.


**What do you need to bring:**
* You love being an Android Engineer and bring that enthusiasm.
* You have good understanding of Kotlin programming languages for Android development.
* You are familiar with Android SDK components like Activities, Fragments, Intents, and Services.
* You have some experience with Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration.
* You have good understanding of RESTful APIs and JSON to connect Android applications to backend services.
* You have a desire to learn and improve your skills.
* You bring curiosity and energy to your work.
* You bring a desire to create fantastic outcomes for users.
* You are at ease sharing your knowledge, experience and opinions, but also appreciate input from your peers.
* You will bring your desire to innovate during lab days and hack weeks.
* We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.


 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0116176

title: Backend Developer Intern
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Backend Developer Intern to join our team for a 6-month unpaid internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in backend development and DevOps within a fast-paced and supportive environment. As a Backend Developer Intern at XR Solutions, you will work closely with our developers.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Implementing APIs: Develop and maintain effective and performant APIs using Node.js and Express.js to support various applications and services.
* System Integrations: Assist in the design and implementation of system integrations, ensuring seamless communication between different software components.
* Testing: Build and execute unitand integration tests to ensure the reliability and efficiency of our systems.
* MBaaS Development: Contribute to our Mobile Backend as a Service (MBaaS) development, helping to create scalable backend services for mobile applications.
* Maintenance: Participate in the troubleshooting, debugging, and patching of existing software to maintain optimal performance and resolve issues promptly.
* Software Quality: Improve software quality by adhering to industry best practices.
* Code Reviews: Engage in code review sessions with other developers to ensure code quality, consistency, and adherence to best practices.
* IT Security: Contribute to maintaining and enhancing IT security protocols, ensuring that all systems are secure and compliant with industry standards.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in Node.js and Express.js for backend development.
* Strong knowledge of JavaScript and its application in server-side development.
* Experience with PostgreSQL for database management.
* Familiarity with AWS services and basic DevOps practices.
* Understanding of version control using Git (We use bitbucket).
* Basic knowledge of IT security principles.



  





**Tools & Technologies:** 



* Development Tools: Visual Studio Code (VSCode), Hoppscotch, pgAdmin.
* Cloud & DevOps: AWS (Amazon Web Services), CI/CD pipelines.
* Project Management: Jira for task management and collaboration.
* Communication: Slack for team communication and coordination.



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience in backend development.
* Exposure to industry best practices in software development and IT security.
* Opportunity to work on real-world projects and contribute to innovative solutions.
* Valuable insights into working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.
 



  





**This is a unpaid internship initially**

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Svea Solar is on the verge of transforming how we manage energy with just the click of a button. We're here to help our customers make the most of their energy usage while also balancing the energy grid with smart, innovative solutions. To bring this vision to life, we're expanding our engineering team and are on the lookout for our next Backend Engineer.
   

  

 As a Backend Engineer, you'll join our Sunbeam Labs, where we’re creating digital services that range from energy optimization to virtual power plants. You’ll work closely with a talented and energetic team of engineers and domain experts, all focused on building cutting-edge software solutions that make energy optimization a reality for our customers.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be involved in every stage of the software development lifecycle, from brainstorming ideas to deployment and ongoing maintenance. Since we’re pioneering services that haven’t existed before, there’s plenty of room for discovery and problem-solving! You’ll be working with thousands of connected devices that we control in real-time, based on measurements taken multiple times per second. Your daily challenges might include figuring out how to distribute work among devices, handling AWS datacenter failovers without a hitch, counting milliseconds and megawatts, and even predicting tomorrow’s sunshine.
   

  

 If you love tackling challenges, writing code, and having fun while doing it, this could be the perfect fit for you!
   

  

**Are we a match?**
 At Svea Solar, we’re all about our values, and we want to make sure they resonate with you too. We’re looking for a Backend Engineer who’s not just experienced, but who’s also passionate about end-to-end development. We’re less concerned with how many years you’ve been working and more interested in your skills, mindset, and enthusiasm. You should be comfortable with architecture styles and APIs (like REST or RPC) and have strong communication skills with a proactive attitude.
   

  

**Here’s what we’re looking for:**
* Experience as a Backend Developer (preferably with .NET)
* A solid understanding of architecture styles and APIs
* Great communication skills


**Bonus points if you have:**
* Knowledge of cloud technologies (we use AWS)
* Experience with Kubernetes and Docker


 If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you! Join us on our mission to revolutionize home energy solutions and create a greener, more sustainable future.

title: Software Engineer in Integration Services
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Integration Services team is looking for an experienced Software developer. In this role, you will work with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem alongside a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You can see the big picture, identify patterns and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas.
   

  

 You will be partnering with teams and areas to support our Unit in driving the integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. Regardless of tools or languages, you build and configure solutions that are easy to maintain and change. You believe in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust and you work with a focus on value creation, growth and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. You will be part of a high-performance team that constantly aims to improve the experience of its end users.
   

  

 Some of your
 **responsibilities** 
 will include:
   

  

* Design, implement and maintain integration platforms to enable software solutions to run in a performant and secure environment
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end value business value
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation
* Troubleshoot, performance tuning, writing technical and functional design specifications
* Responsible for the design, development and some support of multiple integration solutions throughout the organization


**Qualifications**
* 5+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working with Cloud technologies
* 10+ years of experience working as a Microsoft .NET developer
* Experience in developing integrations using Microsoft technologies, including PowerApps and Power Automate.
* Experience with Workato preferred
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid, Azure Entra, Azure app services, API management
* Extensive experience in developing Azure LogicApps applications
* Experience with security aspects APIs and Events
* Experience in deployment and automation using tools like TeamCity, Octopus, Azure DevOps, GitHub etc
* Experience with code quality check tools such as SonarQube, Coverity
* Experience in developing integrations using Microsoft technologies
* Experience working with network routing, security, firewall etc (DNS)
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Development experience in programming languages such as PowerShell, C#, Typescript
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 1st of October. We will review and interview applicants on-going.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Role:**
 Our Observability enablement team needs a consultant who will work closely with the offerings mentioned above within the Operational Intelligence Unit.. We will be quite autonomous, self-organizing and self-sufficient in many ways, which means part of our daily work is to define how we get things done together.
   

  

 Help consumers acquire missing capabilities (around specific technical, or product related functionalities) by bridging that/those capability gaps. E.g. by doing research, trying out options, making informed suggestions on adequate observability tooling, practices, frameworks..
   

  

****Essential requirements:****
* Hands-on & practical experience of log aggregation related to Cloud Platforms, containerized (Docker, Kubernetes) deployments and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experienced in using Git and knowledge about GitHub Copilot or other AI driven tools, and an awareness about it's pros and cons.
* Skilled in Observability, managed as service using Grafana cloud or any similar.
* Be extremely knowledgeable about an emerging and rapidly growing technology by understanding, communicating, and documenting best practices.
* Ensure developers/consumers always get the help they need by providing brilliant documentation, thoughtful technical support, and fostering the tech community through the developer forum and Slack.
* Make consumers lives easier by building and improving documentation, demos, scripts, integrations in the area of Observability.
* Ensure our offerings reflects the needs of the developers in our community by collecting feedback, logging bugs, and contributing to the product yourself
* Experience in growing and nurturing open source community projects.
* Experience with event management products and cloud management at scale is beneficial.
* Ability to synthesize and communicate complex technical concepts and scenarios around observability.
* Hands-on & practical experience of log aggregation related to Cloud Platforms, containerized (Docker, Kubernetes) deployments and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experienced in using Git and knowledge about GitHub Copilot or other AI driven tools, and an awareness about it's pros and cons.
* Skilled in Observability, managed as service using Grafana cloud or any similar.
* Be extremely knowledgeable about an emerging and rapidly growing technology by understanding, communicating, and documenting best practices.


 7+ years of experience of in the area of Observability and monitoring.
   

  

 Someone who wants to make their career progressed as an evangelist, developer advocate, DevRel Engineer, solutions engineer or equivalent role.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Job Description** 




 The interest in flight simulation is soaring, and so are we! Navigraph is currently looking for a Frontend Developer to join our team in Gamla Stan, Stockholm. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to work in a smaller developer team in a mid-size company, serving a large and passionate user base.
 



  





**About Navigraph** 




 Navigraph is a SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) company serving the international flight simulator community with charts, navigation data, flight planning services, and training material. Thousands of subscribers worldwide use Navigraph services in desktop and console flight simulators such as Microsoft Flight Simulator, X-Plane, and Prepar3D. Navigraph users fly for entertainment, curiosity, and possibly with the dream of one day becoming a pilot. Many active pilots also use Navigraph services because of their love for aviation.
 



  





 Navigraph was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Stockholm. The team consists of 35 individuals with varying backgrounds in software development, aviation, marketing, and content creation. About two-thirds live near the Stockholm office, whereas the rest are based in countries such as the US, Canada, Austria, Australia, New Zealand, Ukraine, and the Czech Republic. The office language is English. Because of the rapid technical development of flight simulators and growing interest in aviation Navigraph has experienced a formidable growth over the past few years. Navigraph is still run and managed by its founders Magnus Axholt (CEO) and Stephen O’Connell (CTO). A vibrant user community, a solid product road map, a great product market fit, a thriving business, active and passionate founders, friendly and knowledgable colleagues, and an exceptional company culture make Navigraph a great place to work.
 



  





**Tasks and Responsibilities** 




 As a Frontend Developer at Navigraph you will join the Web Development team responsible for developing and maintaining our main website and its associated user account pages, the developer website, and a Learning Management System used by an upcoming project called Navigraph Academy. The websites should be easy to use, informational, and promotional. The websites are based on Angular and React JS and serve content provided from our different backend systems.
 



  





 Typical tasks include implementing responsive design specified by our Digital Designer using Figma. We also work with performance considerations relating to single-page applications and best practices for content and site structure for SEO. We implement various tracking technologies and A/B tests and keep the websites compliant with current legislation.
 



  





 The Web Development team works closely with the Marketing Team, and we also have an in-house Content Team that produces images and copy for the website.
 



  





 We work according to agile development principles with daily standup meetings, a Kanban board, backlog grooming, and regular retros. There is a clear priority on which tasks and projects to be completed within the year. 
 



  





 As a Frontend Developer at Navigraph, you will be performing the following tasks:
 



  




* **Implement Design:** 
 Turn Figma design sketches into code.
* **Optimize Website:** 
 Reduce loading times and improve website performance.
* **Test User Experience:** 
 Ensure the website is responsive and mobile-friendly.
* **Use SEO Best Practices:** 
 Work with semantic HTML elements; use headers appropriately; enable compression where possible; work with lazy loading; optimize meta tags; review navigation structures; and manage redirects, etc.
* **Support Marketing:** 
 Collect user events for various third-party advertising platforms to improve user experience and assist in A/B testing.
* **Ensure Compliance:** 
 Ensure the website user is informed and has agreed to the privacy policy and that the website behaves accordingly.



  





**Required Qualifications** 




  




* Fluent in written and spoken English
* At least three years of experience in a similar position
* Good knowledge of Javascript, Typescript, and JS frameworks such as Angular or React
* Good knowledge of HTML and CSS
* Experience working with agile methodologies and a solid understanding of software engineering practices



  





**Desired Qualifications** 




  




* Figma
* SEO and performance optimizations
* Wordpress CMS



  





**Personal Qualities** 




  




* Friendly
* Communicative
* Attention to detail
* Curious and eager to learn
* Ability to identify areas of improvement



  





**Benefits** 




  




* **Workplace Insurance:** 
 As a responsible employer, we ensure that you are fully protected at work and during your commute.
* **Pension:** 
 Together with Nordea we help you invest your pension to prepare for a nice retirement.
* **Remote Work:** 
 You are free to work at the office or from home, as you like.
* **Home Office:** 
 We provide you with an ergonomic workplace at home.
* **Health Insurance:** 
 Quick help, typically the next day, to avoid long waits at the doctor’s.
* **Paid Vacation:** 
 You will receive 30 days of paid vacation in advance. This is great if you are joining us right before the holidays.
* **Gym Card:** 
 5,000 SEK/year in health benefits to sponsor your gym or sports club membership.
* **Parental Leave Top-Up:** 
 To compensate for a lower salary while on parental leave.
* **Complimentary Refreshments:** 
 All the cold drinks and warm beverages you need to stay productive and inspired.
* **Free Training:** 
 We help you become an expert in your professional area.
* **Activities, Trips & Parties:** 
 We go on one or two conference trips yearly, host a Christmas party, and regularly arrange team activities.



  





**Application** 




 Please submit your application via the Navigraph Career website at careers.navigraph.com. The position is available immediately, and we are continuously reviewing applications and setting up interviews.

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer | Shared Tech
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Senior Full Stack Developer - Game Operations Platform**
 We are looking for a versatile full stack developer to shape the future of King’s Game Operations Platform where teams build applications to monitor, grow and monetize some of the most popular mobile games in the world such as Candy Crush Saga! The platform contains a suite of software products designed to provide a central, high-quality, robust and extensible toolset with a consistent and stable user experience.
   

  

 The Game Operations Platform team aims to provide a competitive technical ecosystem that allows internal teams to easily build applications and deliver to the platform without worrying about the infrastructure.
   

  

**Your role within our Kingdom:**
 As a member of the Game Operations Platform team, you will play an important role to influence how technology evolves at King and how King teams develop their internal applications that bring great value to our games. You will work closely with your teammates in an agile environment and you will do product discovery, pair/mob programming and code reviews in GitHub. As a platform developer, you will engage in cross-team collaboration and assist other teams in building applications within our platform.
   

  

**Your responsibilities might include:**
* Develop and maintain King internal tech stack including frontend and backend libraries, frameworks and core APIs
* Improve developer experience, such as self-service tooling, that allow King teams to create and manage their applications
* Develop new features that enhance the experience of our end-users who use the platform to monitor and operate king games
* Co-develop internal applications and libraries with other teams
* Research and drive technology innovations across teams
* Showcasing our work in multiple forums such as presenting in demos, mentoring and coaching other developers through tech workshops and onboarding


**Skills to create thrills:**
* Good experience with React and other frontend frameworks/libraries
* Good experience working with backend services using Java or similar
* Good understanding of RESTful APIs and/or RPC APIs
* Familiar with testing frameworks
* A desire to learn new technologies and programming languages across the stack


**:**
* Knowledge of app development using cloud technologies in GCP or similar
* Enjoys working in a dev-ops culture


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Senior backend developer for Team Vaughan (Level 5)
description:
Job Title: Senior backend developer for Team Vaughan (Level 5)
   

  

 Company: main Swedish railway company
   

  

 Max Price rate (SEK/h): Open bid
   

  

 Location: Stockholm centrum, Vasagatan 10
   

  

 Employment type: Full-time, hybrid model with three days/week in the office.
   

  

 Start date: 2024-10-07
   

  

 End date (renewable): 2025-03-31
   

  

 Job Description:
   

  

 We are looking for a Fullstackutvecklare to join our senior team in developing a unique tool that gathers and analyzes a large amount of data in the form of signals from our vehicles and surrounding infrastructure. As part of a team of 8 developers, you will work in a pure Microsoft stack environment, combining maintenance with new development in a forward-thinking technical setting. Our system analyzes data ranging from train doors to rails, and we prioritize the ability to gather all data in one place, something that is currently unique in the industry. In a classic agile spirit, you will be involved in laying the foundation for the maintenance of all our vehicles traveling between 400 stations every day.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop and maintain a unique tool for gathering and analyzing data from vehicles and surrounding infrastructure.
* Work in a pure Microsoft stack environment, combining maintenance with new development.
* Contribute to the maintenance of all vehicles traveling between 400 stations every day.


 Requirements:
   

  

* Several years of experience in development within:
* C#
* SQL
* .NET 6+
* ASP.NET Core
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Entity Framework
* JavaScript
* TypeScript
* Angular/React/Vue.js
* HTML/HTML5
* CSS
* CI/CD
* Technical competence in Docker, Containerization, Azure Kubernetes, Azure Cloud, and DevOps.
* Experience in agile work.
* Curiosity about new technologies and a strong desire to develop and drive your own and the team's work forward.
* Experience with Jira, Kanban, and Scrum is considered a plus.
* Experience working according to SAFe is also a plus.

title: Unity developer intern
description:
Hos
 **Icy Games Studios** 
 är vi passionerade över att skapa roliga, engagerande och visuellt imponerande spel som lämnar ett bestående intryck. Som en oberoende spelutvecklingsstudio fokuserar vi på att skapa upplevelser som fångar spelare med innovativa spelmekaniker och uppslukande världar. Vi söker en talangfull och driven
 **Unity Developer Praktikant** 
 som vill ansluta sig till vårt team och bidra till nästa stora spelupplevelse.
   

  

**Position Översikt**
 Som Unity Developer Praktikant kommer du att arbeta nära vårt utvecklingsteam för att ge liv åt spelkoncept. Detta är en spännande möjlighet för dig som är passionerad över spel och spelutveckling, ivrig att få praktisk erfarenhet och redo att bidra till verkliga projekt.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
* Utveckla gameplay-funktioner med Unity och C#.
* Samarbeta med designers, konstnärer och andra utvecklare för att implementera spelmekanik, UI-element och animationer.
* Felsöka och optimera kod för att säkerställa att spelet fungerar smidigt på flera plattformar (PC, mobil, etc.).
* Delta i brainstorming-sessioner för att förbättra speldesign och användarupplevelse.
* Utföra tester och kvalitetskontroller för att identifiera buggar och åtgärda problem.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom spelutveckling.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Studerar eller nyligen avslutat en examen i datavetenskap, spelutveckling eller relaterat område.
* Bekantskap med Unity och C#-skriptning.
* Grundläggande förståelse för objektorienterad programmering.
* En passion för spelutveckling och en stark vilja att lära sig.
* Goda problemlösningsfärdigheter och uppmärksamhet på detaljer.
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och som en del av ett team.
* Stark kommunikations- och tidsplaneringsförmåga.


**Bonusfärdigheter (Inte Nödvändiga Men Ett Plus)**
* Erfarenhet av 2D/3D-spelutveckling.
* Bekantskap med versionskontrollsystem som Git.
* Erfarenhet av mobilspelutveckling (iOS/Android).
* Kunskap om shaders, fysik och AI i Unity.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* Praktisk erfarenhet av verkliga spelutvecklingsprojekt.
* Centralt kontor.
* En samarbetsvillig och stödjande arbetsmiljö.
* Flexibla arbetstider (möjlighet till fjärrarbete).
* Möjlighet till framtida heltidsanställning efter avslutad praktik.
* Tillgång till alla spel och produkter som utvecklats under din tid på Icy Games Studios.

title: Senior backend developer Java with competence in Azure and AEM
description:
**Job Title : Senior backend developer Java with competence in Azure and AEM - Level 4** 




 Location: Stockholm
 



 Duration: 6 months
 



  
 



**Description:** 




  
 



 The assignment concerns a competitive tender
 



  
 



 Our client is currently in a phase of change and expansion and is growing with more and more business establishments both in and outside of Sweden. Digital innovation is high on the agenda and we have high demands on competitive digital sales channels.
 



  
 



 Our client has begun major work on modernizing and replacing central systems for booking and selling tickets. After procurement, our client has chosen a SaaS system support from Sqills and the work to integrate and supplement the solution has now started. The project includes several agile teams and affects large parts of client's operations and all sales channels. Client's development platform is Azure and we build with Java Spring Boot and microservices in the backend and React with micro frontends for the frontend.
 



  
 



 We are now looking for another senior backend developer with knowledge of Java 17 and Spring Boot for one of our web teams. The team is responsible for core functionality in the web solution, i.a. navigation and purchase of bulk tickets.
 



  
 



 You need to be self-motivated and forward-leaning in development work. Together with product owners, developers and representatives from the business, you need to be able to make decisions and communicate in a clear and un-prestigious way. We work close to the business, which makes it advantageous to have an understanding of the business within travel sales. To succeed in the role, you also need to have good social skills and a positive attitude. We would like to see a person who wants to contribute with perspective and experience in technology/development as well as method/collaboration.
 



 We use agile working methods with a foundation in SAFe and the teams work cross-functionally.
 



 As the project largely works on site at our office in central Stockholm, you need to be able to be on site several days each week, even if parts of the work can be delivered remotely.
 



  
 



 Competences and skills
 



 • Very good knowledge of Java
 



 • Experience with cloud environments, preferably Azure
 



 • Experience with AEM
 



 • Experience with Spring Boot
 



 • Experience with microservices and micro frontends
 



 • Good Swedish and English
 



 • Used to working according to agile methods
 



  
 



 Meritorious
 



 • Frontend development in React
 



 • Certification within Microsoft Azure
 



  
 



 Selection takes place on an ongoing basis and the assignment may be filled before the deadline for responses.

title: Software Developer
description:
***CGMs vision ”Synchronizing healthcare” genomsyrar allt vårt arbete. Vi är marknadsledande leverantör av IT-lösningar och kommunikationstjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård, social omsorg, företagshälsovård, barn – och elevhälsovård samt kliniska laboratorium i Sverige. Vår drivkraft är att göra nytta för patienten via våra e-hälsolösningar. Behovet av nya lösningar är under ständig utveckling, vilket ställer höga krav på oss som leverantör. Tillsammans med våra kunder är vi starkt engagerade i att förverkliga Sveriges e-hälsovision om att bli bäst i världen på att använda digitaliseringens och e-hälsans möjligheter.***
**Din roll**
 Vi söker nyfikna och engagerade utvecklare till vårt Integrationsteam som arbetar med våra integrationer och webbplattformar.
   

  

 Som systemutvecklare i Integrationsteamet tar du ett stort ansvar i hela utvecklingsarbetet och blir involverad tidigt i utvecklingen genom att du bidrar till förstudier oh utredningar. Integrationsteamets huvuduppgift är att stödja våra journalsystem med integrationer och webbapplikationer för datainsamling.
   

  

 Arbetsmetoden sker enligt SAFe och i vår bransch är det höga regulatoriska såväl som säkerhetsmässiga krav.
   

  

  

  

**Om dig**
**Vi Tror Att Du Har**
* arbetat med utveckling i minst 5 år
* god erfarenhet av .NET Framework, .NET, WCF, SOAP, REST och MVC, Razor och WebAPI
* relevant akademisk examen / motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet


 Har du dessutom erfarenhet av Blazor, Webassembly, DevSecOps, Docker och Kubernetes ser vi detta som meriterande
   

  

 Som person tror vi att du är mycket tekniskt intresserad och har ett metodiskt arbetssätt. Hos oss är det viktigt att vi kan hjälpa varandra och vi har en kultur som främjar samarbete och diskussioner.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du förmånen att jobba tillsammans med ett engagerat och trevligt team som alla jobbar mot samma mål och med våra kunders bästa för ögonen. Vi lovar dig komplexa och utmanande arbetsuppgifter och en chans att påverka framtidens sjukvård. Vi erbjuder dig också en arbetsplats i ljusa och fina lokaler i Solna.
   

  

 Att alla medarbetare mår bra tycker vi är viktigt och därför erbjuder företaget bland annat ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme i veckan till alla anställda.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, heltid. Vi har kollektivavtal och erbjuder möjlighet till distansarbete två dagar i veckan. Placeringsort: Solna
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då ansökningar hanteras löpande.
   

  

 Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef My Melander, my.melander@cgm.com

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

**Join our great Development Team at Kambi!**
 Are you ready to take your development career to new heights? Kambi Engineering is seeking a new talent to join our Stockholm-based team, and we believe you could be the perfect fit. Within Engineering we are nearly 400 globally committed individuals, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of the sports technology industry. Here's your chance to be a part of our success story!
   

  

 What sets us apart from others is our unwavering focus on decentralizing decision-making and empowering teams to forge their own paths in problem-solving. We foster a collaborative environment where everyone supports each other in tackling complex challenges, making work not only impactful but also enjoyable. By joining our team, you'll contribute to our continued success and help shape the future of sports technology.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you'll primarily work with Java on a cloud-based environment, applying your expertise in developing, deploying, and owning business-critical systems. We take great pride in our commitment to clean coding practices, ensuring our products are maintainable and of the highest quality over the long term. Additionally, we operate as a DevOps team, meaning you'll have the opportunity to take full ownership of all aspects of our products and components, from idea to deployment/support.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we're seeking candidates who possess the following qualities:**
* Experience as a Developer, having worked in an agile team developing, deploying, and maintaining systems.
* A demonstrated mindset and skill set that aligns with being an effective part of a cross-functional, self-organizing, and self-managing team.
* The ability to write clean, well-structured, and readable code that adheres to best practices.
* Proficiency in writing tests to validate the correctness of your code.
* Fluent in English, enabling effective communication and collaboration.


 In return for your exceptional skills and dedication, we offer a range of benefits and opportunities for growth. At Kambi, we invest in our employees' professional development and provide a supportive and inclusive work environment. You'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and tools, including:
   

  

  

* Java 17+
* Spring framework
* REST/Json
* Linux
* AWS
* Kubernetes (K8s)
* Apache Kafka
* Git version control
* Jenkins
* NoSQL (monoDB/documentDB)


**What’s in it for you?**
* An exciting role within an expanding, progressive department working in a DevOps culture
* An opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
* A fun and flexible working culture with lots of opportunities to grow together with your talented colleagues.


**Learning and Development**
 At Kambi, we encourage learning and provide opportunities for our team members to develop their skills and knowledge. We offer internal trainings, participation in industry conferences, organize hackathons and other collaborative events. We believe that the best way to achieve our mission is to foster a culture of continuous learning and development.
   

  

 If you're ready to be a part of our dynamic and innovative team, take the first step towards an exciting future by applying today with your updated CV in English.
   

  

 Join Kambi Engineering, where limitless possibilities await. Let's shape the future of sports technology together!
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Dynamics CE-Utvecklare med stort hjärta
description:
Det går bra för Fellowmind som helhet och i synnerhet för vårt affärsområde Customer Applications, där vi hjälper våra kunder med implementation och vidareutveckling av CRM inom ramen för Dynamics-plattformen. Vi har en rad riktigt spännande pågående projekt och ytterligare nya där förstudier drar igång i höst/vinter. Därför stärker vi nu upp med ytterligare kompetens på utvecklingssidan inom Dynamics 365 CE.
 



**Vilka är vi då?** 




 Vi på Fellowmind är en ledande europeisk Microsoft-partner som hjälper till att göra den digitala transformationen snabbare för våra kunder genom att använda Microsofts molnlösningar, uppmuntra smidig utveckling, implementera integrerade molnlösningar och hjälpa slutanvändarna att lära sig och anpassa sig till nya lösningar. Vi får människor att trivas med att arbeta med teknologin och får teknologin att fungera för dem. Vi hjälper bland annat våra kunder inom områden som ERP, CRM, Data & AI, Modern Work, Cloud & Security Infrastructure för att nämna några.
 



 Fellowmind är ett värderingsstyrt bolag och med våra värderingar Always personal, Act with courage, Better together och Serious about fun har vi som mål att vara branschens bästa arbetsgivare. Vi tror på att bygga en levande och personlig arbetskultur där alla trivs och kan utvecklas.
 



**Om tjänsten** 




 I rollen som utvecklare kommer du arbeta med att förbättra och utveckla våra kunders affärsprocesser med Dynamics CE plattformen i fokus. Du kommer att bygga integrationer mellan olika system, funktionella anpassningar och kundunika lösningar – allihop affärskritiska för våra kunders verksamheter.
 



 Rent tekniskt kommer du bygga flöden och logik i Power platform (Power Automate, Power Apps), använda JavaScript/Typescript samt bygga plugins och Custom APIs för utökad funktionalitet, med C#.Net som silvertejp i verktygslådan. Sen är React och Power Apps Component Framework värdefulla för att skapa bästa möjliga användarupplevelse.
 



 Vi tror för övrigt på att arbeta testdrivet och noggrant med all vår funktionalitet för att bygga bra lösningar. 
 



 Genom dialog med kollegor och kunder kommer du få sätta dig in i deras utmaningar och klura ut bästa möjliga sätt att lösa dem på. En tjusning är förstås att du verkligen ser nyttan som vi skapar för våra kunders verksamheter.
 



 Du kommer att arbeta med både implementationsprojekt för nya kunder och vidareutveckling av befintliga, där flera åtaganden pågår parallellt. Ofta sker arbetet just i projektform tillsammans med applikationskonsulter, projektledare och arkitekter där du blir en viktig del i våra leveranser. Projektteamet från Fellowmind kan se olika ut i olika projekt, men som du kanske anar så tror vi stenhårt på samarbete mellan olika expertområden för att kunna göra ett riktigt grymt jobb.
 



 Extra kul är möjligheten att kunna vara involverad i det vi kallar plattformsprojekt, som förutom CRM spänner över områden som exempelvis ERP, BI eller Modern Work.
 



**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Idag arbetar med utveckling inom Dynamics 365 CE


* Är förtrogen med den tekniska verktygslådan som ofta används i arbetet, dvs. Power platform (Power Automate, Power Apps), JavaScript/Typescript, plugins och Custom APIs, C#.Net, React och Power Apps Component Framework
* Har ett intresse för verksamhet, affärsprocesser och flöden


* Är analytisk och lätt för att omsätta problem i konkreta lösningar


* Har ett stort engagemang och drivkraft för det du tar dig an


* Har en god samarbetsförmåga och är en teamplayer ut i fingerspetsarna



**Det praktiska:** 




 Start: Gärna omgående, men vi har givetvis förståelse för att du har en uppsägningstid som vi behöver ta hänsyn till.
 



 Omfattning: Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är väldigt flexibla här och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter.
 



 Placering: På något av våra kontor i Malmö, Göteborg, Stockholm, Jönköping eller Halmstad.
 



 Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att bestå av telefonintervju, djupintervju, tester/case och referenstagning.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
description:

title: Snowflake developer to big bank in Stockholm!
description:
Do you have experience with Snowflake and are eager to work in a dynamic global team? A major bank in Stockholm is looking for a passionate Snowflake Developer to join the team and contribute to long-term sustainable systems. Apply now and help them grow in Stockholm!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm, Kungsholmen
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, long term employment
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 In this role, you will be a key player in the banks global development team in Stockholm, working on one of the largest data warehouses. The team is distributed across Stockholm, Poland and India, with ambitions to expand the expertise in Stockholm. You’ll collaborate closely with other developers, testers and Product Owners and participate in daily Scrum activities such as sprint planning and demos.
 


  


 You will be a part of the Development team on Data Warehouse which is a global team with colleagues in Poland and India, however your closest manager is based in Stockholm as well as two of your team members who will guide you during your onboarding. You'll work with technologies such as DataStage, UNIX, TWS and Snowflake and SAFe as methodology and you will have opportunity to perform development activities in Data warehousing solution.
 


  


 The role offers the opportunity to grow within the company, starting as a consultant via Academic Work with a long-term aim for full-time employment at the bank if all parts are happy with the collaboration.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting role where you get the chance to grow and work with modern technologies as well as working at the largest financial group in the Nordic region and one of Europe's largest banks.
  
* You'll get the opportunity to join a global team of experts and learn from senior colleagues, as well as increase your skills as a Snowflake Developer.
  
* The opportunity to develop and advance in your career. As well as working at a global company which value a sustainable workplace, work-life balance with remote work and a diverse workplace.
  
* A dedicated consultant manager from Academic Work who will support and coach you in your career. This is a long term assignment at our client and you'll have an ongoing employment at Academic Work.
  

  


**Work tasks**

 You will work independently to understand requirements from the business teams and implement them in Snowflake following SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) process and contribute to ensure sustainable system solutions through efficient coding and testing.
 


  

  
* Snowflake development in the banks Common Data Warehouse.
  
* Work with data modelers/business to understand the requirement and then implement in the code.
  
* Understanding of SDLC cycle.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* **Bachelor's degree in Computer Science / InformationTechnology**
  
* Minimun of 2 years of experience from working with Snowflake development
  
* Knowledge of Airflow and an understanding of SDLC cycle.
  
* Fluent in English in both writing and speaking
  
* Has a Swedish citizenship or a valid long term work permit to start the position immediately.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience from working with DataStage, UNIX and TWS
  
* Experience from working with different databases such as SQL or Oracle
  
* Experience from development
  
* Experience from the bank industry
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* **Responsible**
  
* **Team-player**
  
* **Intellectually curious**
  

  

**As a person you are**
  

 A team player with the will to help, take ownership and learn. You enjoy collaborating in teams, are eager to develop and learn new skills and you are not afraid to bring your insights to the team / stakeholders. You are curious and have a strong passion for IT!
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Milla Olsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106781

title: Developer Automation
description:
*OM INFINITY IT CONSULTING: Infinity IT Consulting är ett konsultföretag inom IT och Management med en stark företagskultur och teamkänsla. Ditt välmående är vår framgång och vi menar att de bästa konsultaffärerna blir av och genomförs med stolthet när du som medarbetare mår som bäst, så gör även företaget och våra kunder det. Vi jobbar med IT-kunder och partners i hela Skandinavien inom både telekom, verkstadsindustrin, retail, sport & mode och många andra. Vi bygger teamet utifrån våra värderingar som genomsyrar hela företaget. Pannben – Viljan och förmågan att lösa uppgiften, ta ansvar och känna ägarskap, men alltid våga ta hjälp. Enkelhet – Vi krånglar inte till det, varken för oss själva eller för andra! Sunt förnuft och kundnöjdhet i fokus. Laganda – Vi ställer upp för varandra, gör varandra bättre och skrattar varje dag! Långsiktighet – Vi är besatta av att göra bra saker och saker bra, vi låter kortsiktiga vinningar stå tillbaka för långvariga affärsrelationer. Stolthet – Vi är rakryggade, på riktigt och vågar gå vår egen väg! Din IT-karriär kan starta hos just oss och vi ger förutsättningarna för det, eller så är du senior med många års erfarenhet och då ger vi utrymme för allt leda, kompetensutveckla och ge stöd åt våra mer juniora konsulter, och på det viset har vi en härlig mix i konsultteamet av olika utbyten i erfarenhet, intressen och kompetens.*
**Är du en erfaren utvecklare med en passion för automation och problemlösning?** 
 🌟
   

  

 Vi söker just nu en driven och självgående konsult till vårt Automation-team på Infinity! Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med olika kunder och med spännande teknik och utveckling, där vi strävar efter en kunskapsdelande miljö. Du kommer att bidra med din expertis inom PowerShell, Python, C# och REST-API samtidigt som du samarbetar med Business Analysts för att analysera tekniska lösningar och genomförbarhet.
   

  

**Tekniska färdigheter för denna roll:**
* PowerShell
* Python
* C#
* REST-API
* Postman
* Kubernetes


**Bra att ha:**
* Camunda
* Podman
* Kubernetes
* Helm
* Blue Prism


**Önskade personliga egenskaper:**
* Goda kommunikativa egenskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Eget driv
* En teamspelare


 Låter det som en utmaning för dig? 🚀 Då vill vi gärna höra från dig!
   

  

 För frågor kontakta: Hanna Sundin, hanna.sundin@infinityitc.se

title: Lead Salesforce Developer
description:
**Job Title** 
 : Lead Salesforce Developer
 



**Location** 
 : Stockholm, 3 days per week in the office
 



**Languages** 
 : Fluent in Swedish and English (Swedish is essential as it is the primary language spoken in the office)
 



**Job Type** 
 : Full-Time
 



  





**What You Can Expect:** 




 Join a dynamic team focused on developing and managing applications for the insurance brokerage industry, built on both Salesforce and Microsoft .NET platforms. As Salesforce is a new addition to the tech stack, they are expanding the team to bring in expertise that will drive new development, release management, updates, and DevOps.
 



  





 The company has made a significant transition from in-house systems to Salesforce, and they are in the midst of exciting new projects that will build custom applications on the Salesforce platform.
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to work across the full Salesforce ecosystem and contribute to building something new.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Design and Development** 
 : Customize and implement Salesforce solutions to support critical business processes, project goals, and company objectives.
* **Technical Leadership** 
 : Lead technical design sessions, architect solutions, and document technical approaches aligned with business needs.
* **Development** 
 : Work on Visualforce, Apex, Lightning components, and integrations with third-party solutions.
* **Data Management** 
 : Perform data migrations, integrations, and deployments using tools like Data Loader, Workbench, and Change Sets.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration** 
 : Collaborate with internal teams (marketing, product development, operations) to ensure the Salesforce environment meets internal functionality and performance needs.
* **Mentorship** 
 : Provide technical guidance, training, and mentorship to junior developers and other team members.
* **Stay Updated** 
 : Keep up-to-date with Salesforce releases, new features, and best practices, and suggest improvements for the team.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 6 years of experience as a Salesforce Developer.
* Extensive experience with Salesforce development, including Apex, Visualforce, Lightning components, and integrations.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture, data models, and best practices.
* Experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and REST APIs is a plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Salesforce Platform Developer I and II certifications are highly preferred.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments.
* Knowledge of additional programming languages or technologies (e.g., Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS).
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes such as Azure DevOps and Git.



  





**Benefits:** 




 In addition to competitive insurance and pension packages tailored to their business, they also offer the standard benefits most companies in Sweden provide, along with a supportive and collaborative work environment.
 



  





 If you'd like to be considered for this rare opportunity, please send over your application by the 30th of September 2024 or reach out to me directly on s.maritz@masonfrank.com #sweden #salesforce #salesforcedeveloper #salesforcearchitect #stockholm

title: Senior Utvecklare Omada Identity
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Utvecklare och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Nyutveckling av förmågor, tjänster, rutiner och processer kopplade till ett större anläggningsprojekt, där IAM plattformen och Omada är centrala för identitets och behörighets hantering och styrning. Samt införande av nytt behörighetssystem för tillträde till anläggningar inom ramen av samma projekt. Konsulten är del i ett produktteam inom området identiteter och behörigheter.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av informationssäkerhet och behörigheter.
* Erfarenhet av minst 2 uppdrag av införande och implementering av IAM/IGA.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att kravställa design och utveckling i Omada Identity miljö
* Erfarenhet av att dokumentera tekniska lösningar från minst 2 uppdrag inom behörighets- och identitetsområdet


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av minst 4 uppdrag av införandeprojekt kopplat till IAM/IGA .
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i säkerhetsskyddsklassade miljöer från minst 1 uppdrag
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av informationssäkerhet och behörigheter.
* Erfarenhet från minst 1 uppdrag med arbete av rollhantering i Omada Identity.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 03-10-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.
